action.action-desc: Mr. Moran introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for offsetting certain past-due local tax debts against income tax overpayments.

section.header: Offsetting past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligations

paragraph.header: Past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligations

subparagraph.text: A State may, on behalf of a local government located within the State, submit a notice of past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligation for offset under this subsection.
Such submission and offset shall be made with respect to any past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligation under rules similar to the rules of this subsection, except—

clause.text: under paragraph (3)(A), any reduction attributable to a past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligation shall be made (in addition to reductions specified in such subparagraph) after the overpayment is reduced pursuant to—

subclause.text: subsection (f) with respect to any covered unemployment compensation debt; and

clause.text: the local government on whose behalf a State is submitting shall certify to the State that the requirements of paragraph (4) have been met by the local government.

subparagraph.header: Past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligation
subparagraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term past-due, legally enforceable local tax obligation means any debt—

subclause.text: which resulted from a judgment rendered by a court of competent jurisdiction, or a determination after an administrative hearing, which has determined an amount of tax to be due to a local government; and
which is no longer subject to judicial review; or

clause.text: which resulted from a tax imposed by a local government which has been assessed but not collected, the time for redetermination of which has expired, and which has not been delinquent for more than 10 years.

subparagraph.continuation-text: Such term shall not include any local income tax described in the second sentence of paragraph (5).

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall issue such regulations, and modify any such regulations under paragraph (6), as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this paragraph.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to refunds payable after the date of the enactment of this Act.
